TopicTitle: My most wanted feature: Free Rotation on EVA

Articles.Content:
I never understood why this wasn't in the original game. When on EVA as a Kerbal, you could never press Q or E or whatever to rotate a Kerbal on their axis (along with the camera). This made EVA's a hassle to get the proper orientation you needed, since you'd have to work around a camera that was perfectly oriented with Kerbin's pole. Please Devs! Hear my call!

TL;DR: Give Kerbal's a freely rotating camera when on EVA like in Space Engineers.

Edited September 17, 2019 by Doctor_E

I'll do you one better. Give us first person EVAs. I know this is suggested in other threads, but still.

And yes, freely rotating Cameras will give a hilarious upside-down view from Australia. Or Kaustralia.

If you hit V it will change the camera orientation, and your Kerbal will then align to that. I use this any time they're at that perfect "90 degrees from what I want" angle that keeps them from being able to do something (usually, get on a ladder).

If you want to position them perfectly for a screen shot or something though... this probably wouldn't work.
I've always wondered why the camera suffers from the worst case of gimble lock imaginable but them a lot of games still suffer from it

I don't know how many of you guys came to KSP from orbiter, but a lot of us old orbiter-heads remember TransX and the sort, you could plan out an entire trip through the solar system with multiple gravity assists in a simple MFD with the lowest DV possible before you ever launched. I'd LOVE to see something similar. I know It's a stretch, but hey.. you never know.. lol
